def.dt: :an animal that has wings and is covered with feathers A large bird flew overhead. The birds were singing outside our window. a flock of birds see color picture on page C9 see also bird of paradise bird of passage bird of prey
:person He's a tough old bird. see also rare bird
:girl We met some smashing birds at the pub last night.

dro.dre: a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush

dt.snote: The expression a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush means that it is better to hold onto something you have than to risk losing it by trying to get something better.

dro.dre: birds of a feather flock together

def.dt: :worthless or ridiculous This town is for the birds.
:to make an offensive gesture at someone by pointing the middle finger upward while keeping the other fingers folded down He flipped them the bird. [=gave them the finger]
:to loudly shout at, laugh at, or boo someone (such as a performer) in order to show disapproval The audience gave him the bird.

dro.dre: kill two birds with one stone

def.dt: :the facts about sex that are told to children He dreaded having to explain about the birds and the bees [=the facts of life] to his son.

dro.dre: the early bird catches/gets the worm

def.dt: :a dog that has been trained to help people hunt birds called also (Brit) gun dog
:any one of many brightly colored birds that live in New Guinea and in nearby islands
:a bird that travels from one location to another when the seasons change
:a person who wanders to many different places throughout life
:a bird that hunts and eats other animals eagles, hawks, and other birds of prey
:a person who watches and identifies wild birds called also birder

utxt.vi: She goes bird-watching [=birding] with her friends.

def.dt: :seen from high above We had a bird's-eye view/perspective of the city as we flew over it.
:an unusual or uncommon person or thing The little diner is a rare bird in a city full of expensive restaurants.
:a bird with long legs (such as a heron) that finds its food in water called also wader
:a plant that has stems of wood and is smaller than a tree a rose/mulberry bush The bushes [=shrubs] in my yard need to be trimmed.
:a thick growth of hair or fur a bush of hair
:a large area (such as in Australia or Africa) that has not been cleared and that is not used for farming She recently spent several weeks in the bush.

dro.dre: a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush

def.dt: :to avoid saying something by talking about other things Stop beating around the bush and tell me why you're here.
